text:
ORLANDO, Fla. â€“ â€˜Tis the season for a warm Florida Christmas! Hey Weather Insiders, itâ€™s Chief Meteorologist Candace Campos .
If youâ€™re hoping for a chilly holiday week, you might need to travel much farther north as a warming trend looks to hold over the area as Santa comes into town!

â„ï¸â˜ƒï¸ Hunting for that cinematic White Christmas? Iâ€™ve got you covered ðŸŽ„ Snow-covered trees (PIxabay) A WARM welcome back to your newsletter folks, meteorologist David Nazario returning to you to completely avoid talking tropics this go around! Although... note I had to work it in somehow. Itâ€™s instinct at this point, to be expected right?
No, today for your newsletter I want to touch on that symbolic and cinematic White Christmas a lot of us are (Iâ€™d believe) fond of! Maybe not so much if youâ€™re a native Floridian, but I know a lot of you might want to at least experience it once in a lifetime to check it off the old bucket list.
Florida looks to bob and weave like a true boxer avoiding all wintry-style weather down here in the southeast. Overall, it might be a little tricky to get yourselves in the path of a White Christmas and fresh snowfall.
I have a full early breakdown available to you HERE if you have some spare time and want to plan some last minute traveling before the Christmas holiday is in full swing. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions at all!
ðŸŽ„ Holiday fun in the Florida sun â˜€ï¸ How did the end of the year sneak up on us so fast? Christmas is next week, and weâ€™ll be ringing in the New Year before we know it. Hi there! Meteorologist Michelle Morgan here, with a weekend packed with fun and FESTIVE events across Central Florida.
If youâ€™re looking for some last-minute festive fun to enjoy with family or friends â€” or if you have visitors in town â€” this weekend is packed with great things to do, and the weather will be fantastic.
Dezerland Park is hosting a Christmas Wonderland this weekend, and itâ€™s definitely a must-see. You can meet the big guy himself, go ice skating on synthetic ice, check out the go-karts, and explore some really cool antique cars.
Looking for a little staycation? The 12 Days of Holiday Fun at the Orlando World Center Marriott kicks off this weekend and runs through New Yearâ€™s Eve, with tons of activities for hotel guests to enjoy.
